channel.title: Computer on crashdot.com
channel.description: Recent content in Computer on crashdot.com

item.title: KDE Plasma 6: Don’t be fooled by the naysayers on the internet
item.description: Introduction # About a month ago, KDE released their much anticipated next major release of the KDE desktop environment, version 6.

item.title: OpenSUSE Tumbleweed, 6 months in
item.description: Well, here we are, 6 months after installing OpenSUSE Tumbleweed and still no urge to change.

item.title: OpenSUSE: 4 months in
item.description: Maybe it is time for a little update, even if there is not much to say.

item.title: Interesting (or: first tiling windows manager experience)
item.description: The other night, I was playing around watching YouTube videos and was watching this one video from Brodie Robertson on how he was now using Hyprland as his daily driver.

item.title: No more Windows. FreeBSD instead.
item.description: No, I did not stop running OpenSUSE Tumbleweed.

item.title: The end to distro-hopping?
item.description: Introduction # Since I have moved to running Linux basically full time, I have ran Pop!

item.title: Running redundant AdGuard@Home DNS servers on Synology
item.description: Introduction # This is a quick post on how to run multiple instances of AdGuard@Home on a single Synology host using Docker.

item.title: Optimizing Linux for desktop performance
item.description: Introduction # My daily driver is currently Pop!

item.title: Moving a Linux install to a new disk
item.description: Introduction # Recently I had to move my Linux install from one drive to another, as I was experiencing some issues with a WD SN550 nvme drive causing some short random freezes of the GUI with IO intensive tasks.

item.title: Monitoring your network or homelab using Zabbix and Grafana
item.description: Introduction # For the longest time, I have been monitoring my network and homelab using Observium.

item.title: As short as possible: application containers, system containers, virtualization
item.description: Introduction # Sometimes, there is a bit of confusion as to what the difference is between application containers (Docker, Podman, K8S, OpenShift), system containers (LXC/LXD) and virtualization (KVM, Vmware, Hyper-V, Xen) and when you should use them.

item.title: Did you know... (or, RHEL on LXC/LXD)
item.description: There are no RedHat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) LXC/LXD container images publicly available?

item.title: Tested distributions under WSL2
item.description: The following distributions I have installed/created, tested and used under WSL2 and Windows 10.

item.title: Any Linux distribution on Windows 10 with WSL2
item.description: Introduction # WSL 2 on Windows 10 introduced the ability to run a native linux kernel on your computer while using Windows 10 as your main operating system.

item.title: Gentoo on Windows with WSL2
item.description: Introduction # WSL 2 on Windows 10 introduced the ability to run a native linux kernel on your computer while using Windows 10 as your main operating system.
